title: S-D graph - shortage or surplus at 20 USD

content.question: In the competitive market represented by the graph provided, which of the following is true at a price of <math alttext="$20" overflow="scroll"><mo>$</mo><mn>20</mn></math> ?

choices.label: There is a surplus of <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mn>60</mn></math> units.
There is a surplus of <math alttext="35" overflow="scroll"><mn>35</mn></math> units.
There is a shortage of <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mn>60</mn></math> units.
There is a shortage of <math alttext="35" overflow="scroll"><mn>35</mn></math> units.
The quantity sold equals <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mn>60</mn></math> units.

content.answer: There is a shortage of <math alttext="35" overflow="scroll"><mn>35</mn></math> units.

topic.text: 1.6: Market Equilibrium, Disequilibrium, and Changes in Equilibrium

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
